fr.cnrs.iees.graph

Interface EdgeFactory

  • Type Parameters:
    N -
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultGraphFactory

    public interface EdgeFactory

    An interface to give a Graph the ability to create Edges in an appropriate way. cf. NodeFactory for details.

    All graph elements (nodes and edges) are uniquely identified by a class ID / instance ID pair. This pair is used for deciding if nodes / edges are equal (Object.equals(...) method).

    Since Edges cannot exist without Nodes, implementing classes should make sure that the creation of an Edge is appropriately reflected in Node instances (eg by inserting the edge in its start node and end node edge lists).

    Typically, an EdgeFactory should have a constructor taking a Graph as a parameter so that Edge creation is consistent with the current graph context.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux 7-11-2018

    • Method Detail

      • makeEdge

        default Edge makeEdge(Node start,
                      Node end)
        Create an edge with no properties. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The instance ID is automatically generated and is unique.
        Parameters:
        start - the start node for this edge
        end - the end node for this edge
        Returns:

        Returns:

        default Edge makeEdge(Node start,
                      Node end,
                      java.lang.String classId,

        Create an edge with no properties, a particular class ID and instance ID. Implementing classes should make sure the (classId,instanceId) pair enables to uniquely identify the instance returned.
